componentName.description: base part name that describes the form and fit of a component

sourceDatasheetID.description: methods for identifying the human-readable source information for a digital datasheet

digitalDatasheetID.description: methods for identifying the version of the digital datasheet

complianceList.description: list of standards the part complies with

publishedDate.description: date the source datasheet was published

datasheetURI.description: uri to the source datasheet pdf or html view

productURI.description: uri to the source datasheet's product page'

publishedDate.description: date the digital datasheet was published

guid.description: vendor defined guid (see https://www.guidgenerator.com/) to uniquely identify digital datasheet version

terminalIdentifier.description: pin or ball number as defined by datasheet

name.description: name given to the signal appearing at the terminal of a component

description.description: description of the signal appearing at the terminal of an electric/electronic component

numberOfSupportedFunctions.description: the total number of functions supported by this pin

functionProperties.description: list of function objects that can apply to an individual pin

vihMin.description: the least positive (most negative) value of high-level input voltage for which operation of the logic element within specification limits is to be expected

vihMax.description: the most positive (least negative) value of high-level input voltage for which operation of the logic element within specification limits is to be expected

vilMax.description: the most positive (least negative) value of low-level input voltage for which operation of the logic element within specification limits is to be expected

vilMin.description: the least positive (most negative) value of low-level input voltage for which operation of the logic element within specification limits is to be expected

vol.description: the voltage level at an output terminal with input conditions applied that, according to the product specification, will establish a low level at the output

voh.description: the voltage level at an output terminal with input conditions applied that, according to the product specification, will establish a high level at the output

absVmax.description: maximum voltage rating beyond which damage to the device may occur

absVmin.description: absolute minimum voltage that can be applied to a pin

vmax.description: maximum continuous voltage that can safely be applied to a pin

imax.description: maximum continuous current that can safely be drawn from a pin

inputLeakage.description: maximum current draw into a high impedance input pin

outputLeakage.description: maximum current flow from a pin during the off state

dcResistance.description: resistance of a pin of a connector

voltageOptions.description: list of voltage levels supported by a pin

floatUnused.description: description of whether pin can safely be floated if it is not used

internalPullUp.description: indicates the value of an internal pull-up on a pin

internalPullDown.description: indicates the value of an internal pull-down on a pin

esd.description: indicates whether ESD protection exists on a pin

externalComponents.description: list of external component structures recommended to be attached to a pin

componentType.description: type of external component required to be connected to a pin

configuration.description: electrical configuration of component connected to pin with respect to the pin

minValue.description: minimum value of component if a range is specified

maxValue.description: maximum value of component if a range is specified

value.description: value of component if a range is not specified

connectionPin.description: name of pin to which an external component should be pulled up
connectionPin.comment: mostly commonly power or ground pin

perFunctionName.description: name of the function of a pin

interfaceType.description: type of interface enabled by pin

polarity.description: whether the active state of a pin is high or low

siUnit.description: name of SI unit of measure

typValue.description: typical unit quantity corresponding to unit text - example 40mV would have a value of 40

minValue.description: minimum unit quantity corresponding to unit text - example 40mV would have a value of 40

maxValue.description: maximum unit quantity corresponding to unit text - example 40mV would have a value of 40

unitText.description: human readable text describing value - example 40mV would have a value of mV

unitFactor.description: multiplier on the value to achieve the SI unit - example for 40mV the unitFactor would be 0.001

relativeValueReference.description: if unit quantity is based on another reference, value of the reference

relativeValueModifier.description: if a unit quantity is based on another reference, the value that edits that reference

relativeValueOperator.description: if a unit quantity is based on another reference, the operation that is performed with the modifier

valueDefined.description: a boolean representing whether a value has been defined

length.description: length of a side of a package

width.description: width of a side of a package

nominalFootprints.description: references to external footprints in standard CAD formats

breakoutExamples.description: references to external board file that contains layout breakout example

partModelInformation.description: reference to an external XML file that contains a part model in IPC/DAC2552 format

fileDescription.description: text description of the contents of an external file (or files)

companionSoftware.description: optional, name of software program used to access file

standardReferenced.description: optional, name of the standard the file is written in

fileExtension.description: type of file referenced by link

fileName.description: name of external file within the zipped datasheet package

fileURI.description: URI linking to the CAD file

conditions.description: conditions under which the property is measured

activeCurrent.description: current consumption when a device is in active mode

sleepCurrent.description: current consumption when a device is in sleep mode

idleCurrent.description: current consumption when a device is in idle mode

thermalShutdownThresholdRising.description: Thermal Shutdown (tsd) Threshold with temperature rising

thermalShutdownThresholdFalling.description: Thermal Shutdown (tsd) Threshold with temperature falling

powerSupplyProtection.description: undervoltage lockout, overvoltage protection thresholds of a supply

overvoltageProtectionThresholdRising.description: Overvoltage Protection (OVP) Threshold with monitored supply rising

overvoltageProtectionThresholdFalling.description: Overvoltage Protection (OVP) Threshold with monitored supply falling

undervoltageLockoutThresholdRising.description: Undervoltage Lockout Out (UVLO) Threshold with monitored supply rising

undervoltageLockoutThresholdFalling.description: Undervoltage Lockout Out (UVLO) Threshold with monitored supply Falling
